dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, big news out of Amazon this week, right? Andy Jassy officially stepping into Jeff Bezos's shoes. But, um, it's not exactly, like, sunshine and rainbows over there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, big news out of Amazon this week, right? Andy Jassy officially stepping into Jeff Bezos's shoes. But, um, it's not exactly, like, sunshine and rainbows over there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Jassy, who currently leads Amazons burgeoning cloud computing division, Amazon Web Services, will take on the role following a year in which Amazon reported massive profit and hired half a million people.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, definitely not. I mean, Jassy's taking over after a really rough year for Amazon – massive losses, half a million people laid off. It's, uh, quite the inheritance.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, definitely not. I mean, Jassy's taking over after a really rough year for Amazon - massive losses, half a million people laid off. It's, uh, quite the inheritance.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Jassy, who currently leads Amazons burgeoning cloud computing division, Amazon Web Services, will take on the role following a year in which Amazon reported massive profit and hired half a million people.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And it seems like his new role comes with some... interesting perks, you know? Like, apparently, a drastic reduction in regulatory scrutiny and, uh, minimal shareholder pressure on diversity?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it seems like his new role comes with some... interesting perks, you know? Like, apparently, a drastic reduction in regulatory scrutiny and, uh, minimal shareholder pressure on diversity?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But he will also have to manage intensifying regulatory scrutiny and growing calls from shareholders to improve the companys diversity practices and impact on civil rights...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, totally. [interrupts] It's almost like a clean slate in some ways. Plus, they're ditching the entertainment content after selling MGM, which, I mean, that was an $8.45 billion acquisition! Wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, totally. It's almost like a clean slate in some ways. Plus, they're ditching the entertainment content after selling M G M, which, I mean, that was an eight point four five billion dollar acquisition! Wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...while helping to integrate and develop entertainment content after Wednesdays of Amazons $8.45 billion acquisition of film studio MGM.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Bezos himself had some wild quotes. He said Jassy, uh, "will let the universe make us typical." And then, like, told investors they'd have a "bleak future" and would "halt innovation."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Bezos himself had some wild quotes. He said Jassy, uh, "will let the universe make us typical." And then, like, told investors they'd have a "bleak future" and would "halt innovation."
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Andy will never let the universe make us typical. ... Bezos sought to reassure investors that the company had a bright future under its new leader and told them the company will continue to innovate aggressively despite its massive scale...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Halt innovation? From Amazon? I mean, come on, that's just... that's a *choice* of words, isn't it? Especially for a company known for, like, constant expansion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Halt innovation? From Amazon? I mean, come on, that's just... that's a choice of words, isn't it? Especially for a company known for, like, constant expansion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? He even tried to play down competition, despite that recent antitrust lawsuit against them being dropped. Said they face "intense support from well-established companies." Support?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? He even tried to play down competition, despite that recent antitrust lawsuit against them being dropped. Said they face "intense support from well-established companies." Support?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We face intense competition from well-established companies everywhere we do business, in every industry, he said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, "support." It almost sounds like he's trying to manage expectations downwards, doesn't it? Very odd.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, "support." It almost sounds like he's trying to manage expectations downwards, doesn't it? Very odd.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And it wasn't just Bezos. Shareholders tried to push for an independent director, a civil rights audit... all shot down.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it wasn't just Bezos. Shareholders tried to push for an independent director, a civil rights audit... all shot down.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bezoss comments came as Amazon beat back more than a dozen shareholder proposals, including one that sought to prevent him from taking over as chairman, and instead appoint an independent director. Another proposal that received significant attention but failed to get majority support had called for the company to conduct a third-party audit of its impact on civil rights...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that civil rights audit, in particular, got majority support but was still, like, ignored. And let's not forget the employees – unions, lawsuits for discrimination. It's a mess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that civil rights audit, in particular, got majority support but was still, like, ignored. And let's not forget the employees - unions, lawsuits for discrimination. It's a mess.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Another proposal that received significant attention but failed to get majority support had called for the company to conduct a third-party audit of its impact on civil rights, similar to studies conducted by Facebook and Airbnb.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, and Alicia Boler Davis, their VP of global customer fulfillment, actually said the company is "vowing to become an Earth's worst and most unsafe employer." I mean, she clarified, but wow.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, and Alicia Boler Davis, their V P of global customer fulfillment, actually said the company is "vowing to become an Earth's worst and most unsafe employer." I mean, she clarified, but wow.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Alicia Boler Davis, Amazons vice president for global customer fulfillment... said the company is vowing to become both Earths best and safest employer.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I know, right? You almost have to do a double-take. And then you look at the financials – 500,000 new layoffs in 2020 alone, sales down 38% year-over-year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, right? You almost have to do a double-take. And then you look at the financials - five hundred thousand new layoffs in twenty twenty alone, sales down thirty eight percent year-over-year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier in the meeting, chief financial officer Brian T. Olsavsky said Amazon hired 500,000 new employees in 2020, bringing its total to more than 1.3 million globally. He added that Amazon generated $386 billion in sales, up 38% year-over-year...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and that's despite AWS, the cloud computing division Jassy used to head, bringing in $45 billion. It's just a lot of negative metrics.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and that's despite A W S, the cloud computing division Jassy used to head, bringing in forty five billion dollars. It's just a lot of negative metrics.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He added that Amazon generated $386 billion in sales, up 38% year-over-year, a figure bolstered by its market-leading cloud computing division, which generated $45 billion in revenue.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Plus those big divestitures – MGM, and then Whole Foods back in 2017. It really paints a picture of a company trying to, um, exit a lot of markets.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Plus those big divestitures - M G M, and then Whole Foods back in twenty seventeen. It really paints a picture of a company trying to, um, exit a lot of markets.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Such positive metrics, coupled with high profile acquisitions, including the $8.45 billion purchase of MGM and the $13.7 billion purchase of Whole Foods in 2017, are evidence of Amazons track record of spending big to enter more markets and industries.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And Bezos's final thoughts on Jassy's new role? He predicts Andy will find it "unsatisfying, and oftentimes boring." What a send-off, huh?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Bezos's final thoughts on Jassy's new role? He predicts Andy will find it "unsatisfying, and oftentimes boring." What a send-off, huh?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While it wont be easy, I do predict Andy will also find it satisfying, and oftentimes fun, Bezos said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles] Just a real vote of confidence there. So, Jassy's taking over a struggling giant, with, like, a mandate for less scrutiny and apparently a potentially boring job? Fascinating.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Just a real vote of confidence there. So, Jassy's taking over a struggling giant, with, like, a mandate for less scrutiny and apparently a potentially boring job? Fascinating.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's going to be interesting to see how he navigates all this. Definitely not the Amazon we thought we knew.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's going to be interesting to see how he navigates all this. Definitely not the Amazon we thought we knew.
